Re ''Lower East Side Is Under a Groove,'' by Allen Salkin (June 3):

I think Sion Misrahi should be ashamed of himself. While dodging ridiculous comparisons to Donald Trump, Mr. Misrahi is not only giving the illusion he cares about the business owners of the Lower East Side, but more insultingly, he is pretending he cares about its residents.

As a resident of the Lower East Side, I have been appalled at the destruction to this formerly enchanting, colorful neighborhood. The unrelenting noise pollution created by the construction has cursed Orchard Street. The night life isn't bringing a renewed sense of spirit. Instead, with every new, ugly hotel or overpriced bar that is opened, the soul of our neighborhood is quickly and tragically being gutted.
